title: Acknowledgments
content: xvii Acknowledgment Consistent with tradition, the Economic Survey 2025-26 is a product of team endeavour.

Hon’ble Finance Minister Smt. Nirmala Sitharaman’s suggestions early in the process, insights and perspectives prompted deeper reflection and enriched the exercise profoundly. The Survey extends sincere gratitude to the Hon’ble Minister of State for Finance Shri Pankaj Chaudhary, the Cabinet Secretary Shri T.V. Somanathan, Secretary (Expenditure) Shri V. Vualnam, Secretary (DEA) Ms. Anuradha Thakur, Secretary (Revenue) Shri Arvind Shrivastava, Secretary (DIPAM) Dr. Arunish Chawla, and Secretary (Financial Services) Shri M. Nagaraju for their steadfast support.
Contributors to the Survey from core-team encompass the Economic Division and Office of the CEA, and include: Chandni Raina, Anuradha Guru, Chanchal C. Sarkar,  Rose Mary K.

Abraham, Kokila Jayaram, Aditi Pathak, Deepika Srivastava, Gurvinder Kaur, Arun C. Adatte, Mira Sethi, Prachi Singhal, Venkat Hariharan Asha,  Shruti Singh, Gargi Rao, Ritika Bansal, Monika Mangla, Pradyut Kumar Pyne, Pavit, Vishnu K. Venugopal, Manish M. Gade, Vishal Gori, Manju, Rajesh Sharma, Mritunjay Kumar, Amit Kumar Kesarwani, Deepdyuti Sarkar, Rohit Kumar Tiwari, Ajay Ojha, Nikhil Anand,  Aman, Sonali Chowdhry, Bharadwaj Adiraju, Meera Unnikrishnan, Akash Poojari, Surabhi Seth, Ritesh Kumar Gupta, Muna Sah, Brijpal, Shweta, Saloni Chhaparia, Siddharth Singh, Suyash Kumar Jha, Allen George Jose and personal staff of the officers. Their dedication and perseverance, often burning the midnight oil, radiate throughout the chapters.

In addition, the initiative benefited from the active involvement of several officials in the Department of Economic Affairs: Kapil Patidar, Syed Zubair Naqvi, Imtiyaz Ahmad, Tulsipriya Rajkumari, Aparajita Tripathi, Yash Laddha, Aarti Garg, Ram Pravesh Kumar, Sonam Choudhry, and Snehil Shandilya.

Apart from the above, various ministries, departments and organisations of the Government of India collaborated in their respective sectors, these include: Anna Roy, Piyush Srivastava, Anuja Bapat, Kusum Mishra, Aman Sharma, Reetu Jain, Preeti Nath, Sudha Kesari, C.

Vanlalramsanga, Indrani Kaushal, A. Srija, Bijaya Kumar Behera, Sonia Pant, Lalsanglur, J. Rajesh Kumar, Nila Mohanan, Saju K.S., Kamkhenthang Guite, Rajasree Ray, Sangeeta Saxena, Manik Chandra Pandit, Shakil Alam, Yogesh Suri, Rajiv Mishra, Antony Cyriac, Puneet Bhatia, Seema Jain, Saurabh Diddi, Rajeev Kewani, Surjith Karthikeyan, Anusree Raha, Ram Singh, Sadhana Srivastava, Brijesh Kumar Patel, Chandradeep Kumar Jha, Alpana Vats, Pawan Sharma, Akhilesh Sharma, Kumar Sundaram, Shikha Singh, Neeraj Kumar, Jyoti, Naveen Kumar, Depender Rathore, Ravi Yadav, Shambhu Kumar Singh, Vikash Kumar, Virendra Sharma, P.K. Abdul Kareem, Anurag Sharma, Shubham Bachhal, P. Sangeeth Kumar, Shefali Dhingra, Manoj Kumar Singla, K.M. Krishnan, Yogita Swaroop, Sanjeev, Chandramani Sharma, Atul Kumar Sharma, Asvendra Gupta, Pankaj Yadav, Manoj Mehra, Natasha, Santosh Sinha, Bharat Chandra Rout,  Deeksha Supyaal Bisht, Isha Khosla, Rahul Chaurasia, Mahesh Kumar, Sanjay Kumar, Sukhdeep Singh, Manvendra S. Rathod, Kaustubh Rajput, Abhishek Acharya, Unmana Sarangi, Lipika Roy, Sutanuka Sarkar, Swathi S. Senan, Rahul Bhatia, Rashmi Shitole, Reetika Gupta, Sita Ram Meena, Rimjhim T. Desai, Prathibha A., Shashi Ranjan Verma, Utpal Nath, V. Raghunath, Madhu S. Nair,  N. Kalaiselvi, Rohit Kumar, K.S.Rejimon, Shoyabahmed xviii Kalal, Amrit Pal Kaur, Anu Verma, Khushboo Meena, Digambar Swain, Manash Kumar Roy, Sweta Satya, Rishi Kant, Manish Sharma, N. C. Mathew, Manish Bindal, Baidhar Swain, and Santosh Kumar. Views and comments from the State governments of Meghalaya, Odisha, Tamil Nadu, and Kerala significantly enhanced the Survey. We also acknowledge with thanks B.V.R. Subrahmanyam and his team at NITI Aayog for their valuable support in AI-assisted data analytics and visualisations for the Economic Survey.

Various industry bodies, public institutions and private sector entities, including SEBI, RBI, IBBI, IFSCA, GIFT CITY, PFRDA, IRDAI, DGCIS, SIDBI, ISB, IFC, NIPFP, NASSCOM, C-DOT, Artha Global, Good Business Lab, Ei-Educational Initiatives, participated in the process.

Furthermore, we are thankful for the constructive discussions with M.S. Sahoo, Nandan Nilekani, Subroto Bagchi, Tirthankar Patnaik, Mirik Gogri, Bahram Vakil, Abdur Rub, Rahul Ahluwalia, Yuvraj Khetan, C. Veeramani, Prerna Prabhakar, Laveesh Bhandari, Harsh Kumar Bhanwala, M. Moni, Maithreyi Ratan, Arun Gupta,  Suchita Dutta, Shobhit Mathur, Rukmini Banerji, Sridhar Rajagopalan, Neha Garg, Devi Prasad Mishra, Anirudh Srivatsa,  Arunabha Ghosh , Parameswaran Iyer, Richard Damania, Ashish Verma, Aswathy Dilip, Shalabh Goel, Niranjan Rajadhyaksha, Prachi Mishra, Rahul Bajoria, Sajjid Z. Chinoy, Devesh Kapur, N.

R. Bhanumurthy, Digvijay Singh Negi, M. Rahul, Shankar Maruwada, M. Vidyasagar, Swami Manohar, Rahul Matthan, Pratyush Kumar, Kamya Chandra, Lalitesh Katragadda, and Jigar Halani, for offering their in-depth sectoral insights.

Able administrative support was given by Manoj Sahay, Aparna Bhatia, Jasbir Singh, Susruta Samanta, Ajay Kumar Singh, Daleep Kumar, Pankaj Kumar, Davendra Kumar, Rahul Goyal and other staff members of the DEA.

Hindi translation of the survey is credited to the tireless efforts of Pushpalata, Manoj Kumar Thakur, Harish Singh Rawat, Anupam Arya, Samta Rani from Hindi Section, DEA and Rekha Sharma, Gautam Sharma, Sachin Kumar Gupta, Manoj Kumar, Ranjita Shaw, Raveesh Ranjan, Ravishankar Meena, Poonam Verma, and Manish Bhatnagar from the Central Translation Bureau. The Hindi version of the survey was typed by Paljar Lepcha, Santosh Gusain from the Directorate of Printing, Minto Road.

The immaculate page setting of the English and Hindi versions of the Survey was done by Izzur Rahman, Deepak Aggarwal, Divyansh Chhaunkar, Adit Agrawal and Neeru from Signature Printers. The cover page was ideated in-house and designed by Izzur Rahman.

We thank the Government of India Press, Minto Road, for delivering the printed copies of this Economic Survey amidst pressing deadlines. Last but not least, the Economic Survey expresses its profuse thanks to the loved ones of all those involved. This survey would not have been possible without their encouragement and patience.
V. Anantha Nageswaran Chief Economic Adviser Ministry of Finance Government of India
